text.content:
1. Encrypted Messenger (based on Matrix protocol)
   - E2E encryption by default
   - Self-destructing messages
   - Voice/video calls (peer-to-peer)
   - Works over Starlink when ISP is down

2. VPN Config Presets
   - Pre-configured WireGuard profiles
   - Split tunneling for remote work
   - Multi-hop routing options

3. Decentralized File Share
   - IPFS-based storage
   - Encrypted cloud backup
   - Version control for documents

text.content:
1. Mood Tracker
   - Daily check-ins (text or voice)
   - Pattern recognition (AI-powered)
   - Suggests interventions (walk, call friend, etc.)

2. Social Battery Monitor
   - Track introvert energy levels
   - Suggests when to say "no" to social events
   - Plan recharge periods

3. Minimalist Journal
   - Distraction-free writing
   - Gratitude prompts
   - Exportable markdown files

4. AI Companion Bot (Telegram/Discord)
   - Non-judgmental listener
   - Suggests coping strategies
   - Checks in when you're quiet for too long

text.content:
Frontend:
- Next.js 15 (App Router)
- Tailwind CSS + Custom pixel theme
- Framer Motion (animations)
- Canvas API (for pixel art editor)

Backend:
- Supabase (PostgreSQL + Auth + Storage)
- Cloudflare Workers (edge functions)
- Redis (caching + rate limiting)

Communication:
- Matrix Server (self-hosted, encrypted)
- Telegram Bot API (AI companion)
- WebRTC (P2P video/voice)

Infrastructure:
- Cloudflare CDN + DNS
- DigitalOcean VPS (2v4g for start)
- Backblaze B2 (file storage)
- Starlink API integration (future)

Analytics:
- Plausible (privacy-friendly)
- PostHog (self-hosted alternative)

text.content:
When your ISP fails:
1. OECE desktop app detects no connection
2. Automatically attempts to connect to Starlink (if available)
3. Establishes mesh network with nearby OECE nodes
4. Limited bandwidth mode: text-only messenger, cached docs
5. Emergency broadcast: "Node XYZ is now in offline mode, will resurface when stable"

Layer 1: Foundation (All Free/Open Source)
â”œâ”€â”€ OS: Linux (Debian/Ubuntu/Arch) or macOS
â”œâ”€â”€ Browser: Firefox + uBlock Origin + Privacy Badger
â”œâ”€â”€ Password Manager: Bitwarden (self-hosted)
â”œâ”€â”€ VPN: WireGuard (self-hosted) or Mullvad
â””â”€â”€ Backup: Restic + Backblaze B2

Layer 2: Communication (Encrypted by Default)
â”œâ”€â”€ Messenger: OECE Matrix server (self-hosted)
â”œâ”€â”€ Email: ProtonMail or self-hosted (Mailcow)
â”œâ”€â”€ Voice/Video: Jitsi Meet (self-hosted)
â”œâ”€â”€ File Sharing: Nextcloud (self-hosted)
â””â”€â”€ Notes: Obsidian (with self-hosted sync)

Layer 3: Development (Geek Tools)
â”œâ”€â”€ Editor: Neovim / VSCode with Copilot
â”œâ”€â”€ Terminal: Alacritty + Zsh + Oh My Zsh
â”œâ”€â”€ Version Control: Git + self-hosted Gitea
â”œâ”€â”€ Containers: Docker + Docker Compose

text.content:
Reasons:
1. Privacy - Your data never leaves your server
2. Cost - $12/month VPS vs $50/month SaaS subscriptions
3. Control - No random ToS changes or shutdowns
4. Geek Cred - "I run my own email server" flex
5. Learning - You become ops-literate

Trade-offs:
- Setup time: 10-20 hours initial
- Maintenance: 2-4 hours/month
- Risk: If you misconfigure, you break things
- Responsibility: You're the sysadmin

OECE provides:
- Pre-configured Docker Compose files
- One-click deployment scripts
- Monitoring dashboards
- Backup automation
- Community support (Discord)
